channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dalkeith Road SE21 cycle locker, 10th January
item.description:
Dalkeith Road SE21 a few feet from streetlight column ID number 9 (/ side of house number 4 Turney Rd) green coloured power coated metal Lambeth cycle locker graffiti tagged. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for reporting pin and picture.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 52, Dalkeith Road, Tulse Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Denmark Hill SE5 outside house number 190 (just, 10th January
item.description:
Denmark Hill SE5 outside house number 190 (just by streetlight column ID 52) gutter grate 100% blocked – needs unblocking. Picture attached.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blanchedowne, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 15 inch pothole, 10th January
item.description:
I was driving on the north circular on the 08/01/26 at 11.30am when my car hit a very big pothole. My tyre on the left passenger side got a massive hole to the point where I had to come off the north circular and pull into a petrol station in Palmers Green. This could have caused a massive accident if I didn’t act quickly? I then had to go to a tyre place to have my spare tyre put on. I then managed to drive back home in south London witch took me 3 hours to get home due to doing only 30mph I then had to go and pay £200 for a new tyre which I found done by as my tyre was fairly new? Unfortunately I couldn’t stop to take any photos due to location on the north circular as there wasn’t anywhere I could stop as it’s on the dual carriage way with cars driving very fast…? I hope you can locate the hole so hopefully no one gets involved in a car crash or anyone else experiencing what I just gone through? Hopefully I would hear from you soon Thanks Claire Georgiou Car reg is C2ERY also hopefully you have cameras and would be able to see my car going through at this time and location when it happened
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Advent Way, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cracking and Bitumen filling problems, 10th January
item.description:
From nNo 26 to the road entrance to the carehome . Cracking issues of concrete Bitumen filling poor here. Needs the bitumen relaid properly between the concrete section of the surfacng. Age , or poor workmanship or poor quality bitumen used. Contractrs work needs assessing by Council techical person. Not a good use of council tax payers money.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Harland Avenue, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Harland Ave intersection with Brooklands Avenue ( Ulez Camera ), 10th January
item.description:
Another harland insection with Brooklands which has traffic from vehicles and parents/ children going and comming back.from the Primary School. . Surfacing in general poor condtion with the common faults associated with the age/ quality etc . Poor bitumen levels in places..resulting in poor drainage just where there is foot traffic crossing both sections of Harland Ave. Old , tired and dangerous. Especially as it tight turning into both Little birches and Brooklands Ave. Traffic speed down & up Harland avenue in this aprt as relatively straight so see cars easily ,,,but for the foot traffic not helpful .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Harland Avenue, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: An overhead glass panel has been smashed with, a hole left in it. There is lots of glass on the floor and, there is still a large amount of glass still overhead, leaning down, ready to fall on to pedestrians at any moment., 10th January
item.description:
The above summarised damage and, immediate threat to public safety is to overhead glass panelling above a bus stop outside of Boots, widmore road, Bromley
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Widmore Road, Plaistow, Greater London

item.title: Illegal footway obstruction, 10th January
item.description:
Latin Hits at 14 Stoke Newington Rd, London N16 7XN keeps putting out extra tables and chairs on the footway, beyond their permitted area, which are hazardous to pedestrians, particularly when the venue gets busy and the tables and chairs get moved around.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Road, London
